Events that occurred on 28 August

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1898 - R.B. McCallum, Inkling is born
1967 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to a Mr Joukes.
1968 - Actor Billy Boyd is born.
1973 - J.R.R. Tolkien takes a holiday to visit friends in Bournemouth. He would die there 5 days later.
1977 - Mythcon 8 at University of San Diego, California.
1981 - Tom Shippey reviews The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien for The Times Literary Supplement.
1982 - The seventh episode of the new version of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
1987 - Voice actor John Huston dies.
2010 - The Tolkien Society's Southern Hemisphere seminar: "Tolkien's Odysseys - Middle-earth and Beyond".
2014 - Tolkien Calendar 2015 is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
Gandalf, Celeborn, Galadriel and the four Hobbits overtake Saruman and Wormtongue. While Frodo and his friends go to Rivendell, Saruman heads straight for the Shire.[1]

content.title: References
content.content: ↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix B, "The Chief Days from the Fall of Barad-dûr to the End of the Third Age"
